meanings.definition: To board a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The passengers were imbarking the cruise ship for their vacation.
meanings.sent2: We will be imbarking the plane to our destination shortly.
meanings.sent3: The penguins were imbarking the ship, excited for their Antarctic adventure.
meanings.sent4: The dreams of traveling the world were imbarking in her mind like a grand voyage.
meanings.sent5: The image of imbarking the spaceship to explore the galaxy filled his imagination with wonder.

meanings.definition: To begin a journey or venture.
meanings.sent1: She was imbarking on a new chapter in her life by starting her own business.
meanings.sent2: The explorers imbarked on their expedition into the unknown jungle.
meanings.sent3: The idea of imbarking on a quest for the lost treasure seemed thrilling.
meanings.sent4: His heart imbarked on a quest for love, hoping to find it along the journey.
meanings.sent5: The young knight imbarked on a quest to rescue the captured princess from the dragon's lair.

meanings.definition: To load or pack onto a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The crew was imbarking the cargo onto the freighter for the long voyage.
meanings.sent2: They imbarked the supplies onto the aircraft before takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The workers were imbarking the equipment onto the ship, preparing for the expedition.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past imbarked onto his mind like heavy luggage.
meanings.sent5: The excitement imbarked into the atmosphere as the goods were loaded onto the ship.
